channel.title: Donator Cape help
channel.description:
Source: Solitude 317
Basicly i want to get a donator cape that gives you x2 xp when worn
I've tried to search on google but i cant find it since there is no "itemdef" or something close to that in the source. Well i have some models and i've added them. But i still need a place to put the code... Anyone got any ideas?

item.title: Donator Cape help
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

Quackie:

Clearly not lol… Im kinda new to RSPS coding… Soz for being a noob…

Don’t ever apologize for a lack of knowledge, to anyone, for any reason. I salute your effort and your charisma!

The variable “c” stands for Client. Which is a direct reference to the Client class. (I’m going to explain something, not because I think you’re un-intelligent, but because you said you were new.)

The Client class refers to the java file with the name Client. In Java we refer to them as classes because when they’re compiled that’s what the jvm uses to read and run your code. To use code from another class we have to make a reference to it either through an import and a getter or we can directly state the directory, which you sometimes see in PI when it has code like:

src.server.itemHandler.ItemAssistant or whatever.

The c variable is typically used to shorten the code from having to type Client to merely type c.(method name in the client class here). So, you can either directly state the Client class or you can add the c variable to be recognized as the Client class. I’m not going to tell you how to do either, because it’s a better learning experience if you can do it for yourself. If you have a question on what I mean, feel free to ask, if you have a question on how to do it use Google

P.S. Sorry for the long reply time, I’m at work.

Read full topic

item.title: Donator Cape help
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

[quote=“Quackie, post:10, topic:443475”]The error is:

src\server\model\players\Player.java:391: error: cannot find symbol c.setExperience *= 2; ^ symbol: variable c location: class Player Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 1 error[/quote]

Do you know what the c stands for?

Read full topic

item.title: Donator Cape help
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

[quote=“Quackie, post:7, topic:443475”][quote author=Skiire link=topic=546159.msg4003862#msg4003862 date=1338400788]

I want it that way. Is that a problem?

No, it’s not. It’s creative and unique, I support you.

Anyways, if statements are your friends…

if(c.playerEquipment[cape] == donatorCapeId) {
c.setExperience *= 2;
}

Ignore conventions, I typed that in the reply box. Anywho, that’s saying if they’re wearing a donator cape then they get two times the xp. Add the variable setExperience everywhere in combat where they receive exp or you can use a pre-set variable if it’s available to you. Convert this for your specific source.
[/quote]Thanks for it would Rep++ if i could… But i only got one error (fixed the other ones) Its the c.setExperience. I’ve tried other codes but its not working Anyone know something about that?[/quote]

No problem, don’t worry about Reputation, it means nothing.

What’s the error?

Read full topic

Add the variable setExperience everywhere in combat where they receive exp or you can use a pre-set variable if it’s available to you. item.title: Donator Cape help
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

Quackie:

I want it that way. Is that a problem?

No, it’s not. It’s creative and unique, I support you.

Anyways, if statements are your friends…

if(c.playerEquipment[cape] == donatorCapeId) {
c.setExperience *= 2;
}

Ignore conventions, I typed that in the reply box. Anywho, that’s saying if they’re wearing a donator cape then they get two times the xp. Add the variable setExperience everywhere in combat where they receive exp or you can use a pre-set variable if it’s available to you. Convert this for your specific source.
